#  8 Best Car Maintenance Apps Available

Joseph MaxwellUpdated: Dec. 01, 2023

  *   *   *   *   * 

d3sign/Getty Images

Do you hate keeping track of your vehicle's maintenance schedule? These apps
can track service, repairs and fuel economy with the touch of a button.

Advertisement

Car maintenance can be daunting. With so much to do and busy lives, it’s
difficult to remember to schedule things like oil changes and brake jobs or
even the maintenance tasks you can do yourself. Fortunately, there are a
number of phone apps help you keep track of your vehicle with regular
maintenance reminders, service records, fuel-tracking and much more.

## CARFAX Car Care

With the free CARFAX Car Care app you can track service on up to eight
vehicles, making it a great choice for extended families or anyone managing a
small motor pool. It provides service reminders based on your specific car
model and will quickly alert you to any safety recalls. One user reported they
loved the app because it “automatically uploads when you have service done.”

## Drivvo

Drivvo is another free app that lets you track fuel to help save money on gas,
as well service and registration costs in one place. It’s convenient for
personal and professional drivers. The app lets you categorize vehicle expense
information into graphs to manage spending. Excellent customer service also
sets this app apart. One user reported that “support is super fast,
professional and pleasant!”

## AUTOsist

If you hate paper receipts, you’ll love the mobile scanning feature of the
free AUTOsist app. It converts maintenance receipts into digital expense and
service logs, available anytime, even when you’re offline. If you’re someone
who’s fine with paper, you can print your digital service records at any time.
If you’re looking to sell a car, AUTOsist can send your service records to
anyone with one click.

## My Car

With cost tracking, service reminders and a clean user-interface, the free app
My Car offers everything you’d expect in a top-notch car maintenance app. It
supports multiple vehicles and lets you easily integrate information from
other apps. The sleek and simple interface is popular with users. One reported
that the app is “easy to use and offers just enough features.”

## Fuelly

The seamless integration the free Fuelly app offers is perfect for anyone who
wants their information in multiple places. Each time you enter info through
the app, it’s automatically added to your account on Fuelly.com. The app also
offers individual vehicle customizations and an Excel compatible email report.

## Simply Auto

Besides everything you’d expect from a top-rated car maintenance app, Simply
Auto offers built-in GPS-tracking to easily record all tax-deductible and
reimbursable mileage. Available for free, it’s also the only app that allows
users to track fuel economy based on octane, brand and filling station.
Electric car users have the option to track in kilowatt-hour (kWh).

## Openbay

Openbay is a free app that offers competitive service estimates from different
providers in your area, saving you money. Once you’ve reviewed quotes, you can
book an appointment with your preferred service center right in the app. It
keeps detailed logs on work completed and remind you of routine maintenance
requirements.

## Auto Care 1

The Auto Care 1 app registers distance in miles or kilometers and fuel in
gallons or liters, helpful for people who drive outside the U.S. Users can set
maintenance reminders based on mileage or time of the month. And this app
automatically backs up all your data on iCloud, giving you peace of mind.
Unlike the others, Auto Care 1 is not free (it’s $4.99), but most users were
happy to pay that for the additional features offered.

Originally Published: March 21, 2021

####

Joseph Maxwell

Joseph Maxwell is a writer and an All-American collegiate athlete. Originally
from Ontario, Canada, Joseph earned an athletic scholarship to the University
of Tennessee where he studies marketing. Growing up on his parents' 92-acre,
modern homestead property, Joseph learned woodworking, metalworking and a
variety of mechanical skills.

## Cookie Preference Center

Our website uses cookies and tracking technologies (collectively, “Cookies”)
to understand site performance, enhance our marketing efforts, and serve more
relevant content and advertisements to you. This Preference Center allows you
to opt out of the disclosure of personal information we collect through
certain Cookies, including opting out of sales and sharing for targeted
advertising. You can exercise this opt out by changing the toggles in the tab
below. You may also opt out of the sale of your personal information in other
contexts by clicking on the “Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information”
link in the website footer.  
  
**Opt Out Preference Signal:** If you would like to opt out of sales and
sharing via an opt out preference signal you can do so by utilizing a browser
or extension that supports opt out preference signals.

Allow All Cookies

###  Manage Cookie Preferences

#### Strictly Necessary Cookies

Always Active

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched
off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by
you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy
preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block
or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then
work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

#### Targeting Cookies

Targeting Cookies

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They
may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show
you relevant advertisements on other sites. They do not store directly
personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and
internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less
targeted advertising.

#### Social Media Cookies

Social Media Cookies

These cookies are set by a range of social media services that we have added
to the site to enable you to share our content with your friends and networks.
They are capable of tracking your browser across other sites and building up a
profile of your interests. This may impact the content and messages you see on
other websites you visit. If you do not allow these cookies you may not be
able to use or see these sharing tools.

#### Performance Cookies

Performance Cookies

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure
and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are
the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All
information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If
you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our
site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.
